item.title: Making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 550.

item.title: To prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the United States, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 551.

item.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 191 (Roll no. 477). (text: CR H7206)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 191 (Roll no. 477).(text: CR H7206)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 183 (Roll no. 476). (consideration: CR H7212-7213)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 710.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H7206-7213)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 135.

Provides for further consideration of H.R. 5230 and for consideration of H.R. 5272. Both bills are debatable for 1 hour. The amendments to H.R. 5230printed in part A of the report shall be considered as adopted. The amendment to H.R. 5272 printed in Part B of the report shall be considered as adopted. The rule provides for one motion to recommit with or without instructions for each measure. The rule amends section 2 of H.Res. 700 to allow for motions to suspend the rules with respect to a measure addressing missile defense of Israel.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-571, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-571, by Mr. Sessions.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5230) making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5272) to prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the United States, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5230) making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5272) to prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the United States, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
